programme.title: The Narrows
programme.desc: A 19 year old photography student has to balance his neighborhood roots with a sophisticated world while attending NYU.

programme.title: Queen of the Desert
programme.desc: Gertrude Bell's life as an explorer, cartographer, and archaeologist for the British Empire.

programme.title: That Summer
programme.desc: In 1972 Lee Radziwill asks Peter Beard to help make a film about her childhood on Long Island. Her eccentric cousins, the Beales of Grey Gardens, become the focus of the project.

programme.title: Cole
programme.desc: A guy from a small town feels obligated to return there when his sister's home life falls apart.

programme.title: Hungry Hearts
programme.desc: A new mother's increasingly unstable behavior threatens her relationship with her husband (Adam Driver) and the life of her infant.

programme.title: XX/XY
programme.desc: An artist (Mark Ruffalo) begins a romance with a collegian (Maya Stange), then goes his own way and runs into her eight years later.

programme.title: The Duke of Burgundy
programme.desc: Two entomologists (Sidse Babett Knudsen, Chiara D'Anna) play ritual games of dominance and subservience.

programme.title: Ali & Nino
programme.desc: Ali Khan Shirvanshir, the male descendant of a royal Muslim family, falls in love with the beautiful Nino Kipiani, a Georgian princess who is Christian, while he is in Azerbaijan during World War I.

programme.title: Every Thing Will Be Fine
programme.desc: After he causes a car accident, Tomas (James Franco) spends the next 12 years examining the effects of the tragedy on his life.

programme.title: Freak Show
programme.desc: Billy, a cross-dressing teen, starts attending an ultra-conservative high school. He takes a stand for his individuality by running for homecoming queen.

programme.title: The Imperialists Are Still Alive!
programme.desc: A French party girl (Élodie Bouchez) in Manhattan finds romance on the same night she learns that her childhood friend has disappeared.

programme.title: Nobody Knows
programme.desc: A woman abandons her four children (Yûya Yagira, Ayu Kitaura, Hiei Kimura) in a tiny apartment, leaving them to fend for themselves.

programme.title: Medicine for Melancholy
programme.desc: A black couple (Wyatt Cenac, Tracey Heggins) in San Francisco discuss issues of race, identity and the growing gentrification of their city.
